title: "Falso ego e la liberazione della mente"
first_phrase: In the previous paragraphs, we talked about the concept of knowing oneself and the false ego that often hinders our path to self-awareness. This brings us to the idea of the "kairos," the expanded time of manifestation in which we can fully live in the present moment. In this final part, we will explore the ancient symbolism of the bull and its significance in overcoming the organizing principle of our mind. This symbol represents the fixation of our perception in a particular way that limits our thoughts, emotions, and reactions. Through the symbolic slaying of the bull, we can evolve towards a more vertical and expanded understanding of ourselves.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the ancient symbol of the bull represents our fixed perception, which limits our thoughts, emotions, and reactions. The killing of the bull symbolizes the transcending of this organizing principle of our mind. By understanding and overcoming our fixation, we can unlock the workings of our subconscious mind and break free from limitations in our psychology and identity.
